tutorial.title: Today's Lunch Page
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use flexbox to style the layout of a lunch-of-the-day page

executableContent.instructions:
A popular restaurant in Greece needs your help in creating a page for today's lunch menu.

We already have HTML markup and some styles for the meals and footer sections. We'll use flexbox to justify flex items in their sections.

Let's go through the different classes as well. 

1. There is one `div` that has the class `container`, that holds all courses for today's lunch. The `.container`  has many child `div` elements with the class `.item`. These children contain the food item type and name. 
2. We also have a `.footer` section with links. 
3. In styles.css, we have added some styles for the container, items, footer, and heading.

1. Set the height of the `.container` div to `260px`.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we need the flex items in the menu to appear in a column. 

1. Code the `flex-direction` value in the menu that arranges the flex items into a column.

executableContent.instructions:
If you run the code, you'll see that the footer items are still aligned on the left. Let's center-align them.

1. Align the footer items to the center.
2. Write a ruleset for all `a` elements. Inside the rule, set the right margin to `10px`.
